name: Kazuo Ishiguro, small
occupation: Novelist, short story writer, screenwriter, columnist, songwriter
genre: Drama, historical fiction, science fiction, genre fiction
notableworks: ''An Artist of the Floating World'' (1986), ''The Remains of the Day'' (1989), ''When We Were Orphans'' (2000), ''Never Let Me Go (novel)
education: University of Kent (BA), University of East Anglia (MA)
